history.content: Option 3 seems suitable provided the upper div isn't too heavy. Also, if you aren't a senior, getting into DS 102 doesn't seem likely.

children.subject: Where can we find more information about DS 102? Couldn't seem to find anything online.
@anon 2 above, you can find more about it in the Data 001 Piazza where they announced it; the pilot is launching this fall so that's why there is hardly any info about it online.
To follow up to the student answer, I plan on taking DS 102 as a senior. Also, since I'm a sophomore, hopefully the class course will expand by the time I take it?

history.content:
Hi, I'm a double CS/DS major and to fulfill both of the majors' requirements, I basically have to choose between these 3 options:

  1. Stat 140, Math 53, and CS 189
  2. EE 126 and DS 102
  3. Stat 140, DS 102, and some other upper div CS class 

Any feedback on which one seems like the best option? (DS 102 is a new course that fulfills the ML/modeling requirement for data science)

Honestly I prioritize manageability over utility but both are very important to me, if that helps.
history.subject: Feedback on DS+CS course plan
